content: looks best facing out in the image below the yarn is joined with the pebbly side facing the crocheter this will ensure that when the hat is complete the pebbly side will be facing out row 1 join your mc in any chain-1 space at the tip of a petal chain 8 slip_stitch in the chain-1 space at the tip of the next petal 7 times join at the same chain-1 space at the beginning of the round row 2 chain 2 1 half_double_crochet in same space 7 half_double_crochet in the large loop created by the chain-8 from the previous round 2 half_double_crochet in the chain-1 space at the tip of the next petal continue around and join to the 2nd chain of the chain-2 at beg of round you should have 72 sts when you finish this round row 3 chain 2 work around 4 half_double_crochet 2 half_double_crochet in next st join you should have 84 sts when you finish this round row 4-7 change to 8mm hook chain 2 half_double_crochet around and join to 2nd chain at beg of round row 8 switch back to 6mm hook chain 2 half_double_crochet around and join to 2nd chain at beg of round row 9 chain 2 3 half_double_crochet hdc2tog continue around and half_double_crochet in the last 5 sts of the round join you should end up with 69 sts row 10 chain 2 half_double_crochet around and join to 2nd chain at beg of round row 11 chain 2 3 half_double_crochet hdc2tog continue around and half_double_crochet in last 4 sts of the round join you should end up with 56 sts row 12 chain 2 half_double_crochet around and join to 2nd chain at beg of round row 13 switch back to 8mm hook chain 3 and double_crochet around join to 3rd chain at beg of round row 14-16 chain 3 fpdc around skip very last fpdc to ensure the rib pattern created by the fpdc stitch join to 3rd chain at beg of round row 17 chain 1 reverse single_crochet around and slip_stitch to chain 1 turn the hat inside out weave in ends useful links reverse single_crochet can be kind of a tricky stitch here s a helpful video http //www youtube com/watch v=jhsbycwfpdo here s a video for front post double_crochet the handy ribbing stitch http //www youtube com/watch v=6l1zqach5uc this site has an excellent collection of crochet tutorial
